document.docAuthor: Onuferko, Thomas M., Packer, Laurence & Genaro, Julio A.
document.masterDocTitle: Brachymelecta Linsley, 1939, previously the rarest North American bee genus, was described from an aberrant specimen and is the senior synonym for Xeromelecta Linsley, 1939

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Brachymelecta Linsley, 1939, previously the rarest North American bee genus, was described from an aberrant specimen and is the senior synonym for Xeromelecta Linsley, 1939

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Department of Biology, York University, 4700 Keele St.
Florida State Collection of Arthropods, 1911 SW 34 St.

emphasis.emphasis: Key to both sexes of the species of

paragraph.keyLead: â€“ Mandible tridentate, with inner basal tooth as well as inner preapical tooth and usual apical tooth (rutellum) ( Fig. 14B ). Mesoscutum with pair of spots or bands ( Figs 3B , 5B , 10B , 11 , 13B , 16B ). Mesoscutellum with pair of spines or mammiform tubercles (least developed pair shown in Fig. 13D ) (see also Figs 3D , 5D , 10D , 16D ). Mesotibia dorsally with some off-white or yellow-orange hairs, those of female sparser and usually reduced to small bands or spots ( Figs 3Aâ€“B , 5A , 10Aâ€“B , 11 , 16Aâ€“B ); those of male forming patch of very dense off-white, golden-yellow, or yellow-orange hairs, occupying nearly entire dorsal surface ( Figs 3C , 5C , 7A, C , 8Aâ€“B , 13C , 16C ). T1â€“T3 with well-defined off-white to golden-yellow or yellow-orange apical fasciae ( Figs 3Aâ€“C , 5Aâ€“C , 8Aâ€“C , 10Aâ€“C , 11 , 13Aâ€“C , 16Aâ€“C ), rarely entirely covered in pale tomentum ( Figs 7Aâ€“C , 8D ) ............. 2

2. Mesoscutum with pair of anterior spots or bands of hairs darker than surrounding off-white or yellow-orange hairs ( Figs 5B , 13B ). Mesoscutellum with pair of short, mammiform tubercles ( Figs 5D , 13D ). Maxillary palpus with four or five palpomeres ( Fig. 12A ) [North America] .................. 3

â€“ Mesoscutum with pair of central spots of off-white or pale to golden-yellow hairs lighter than surrounding black hairs ( Figs 3B , 10B , 11 , 16B ). Mesoscutellum with pair of spines ( Figs 3D , 10D , 16D ). Maxillary palpus with fewer than four palpomeres ( Fig. 12B ) [Greater Antilles] ................. 4

â€“ Mesoscutum and mesoscutellum each with uninterrupted band of pale hairs along entire midline ( Figs 10B, D , 11 , 16B, D ). Mesoscutellum pubescence otherwise dark brown or black, sparse, not obscuring underlying integument ( Figs 10D , 16D ) [other regions] ................................................. 5
